Typography — What Language Looks Like.

November 20, 2009 Tags: Design
Typography, I hold you responsible.Responsible for hours spent scrolling through lists of fonts trying to find one that "works" with Copperplate Gothic. Responsible for giddy excitement at discovering free downloads of 1001 Mac Fonts. Responsible for awkward cringes at misused combinations of Futura and Verdana. Responsible for the Helveticazation of the corporate world and the Comic-Sans-zation of public health handouts. Responsible for homework procrastination, magazine destruction, poster fascination, headache provocation, design obsession. What do you have to say for yourself? I don't know what Typography would say in its defense, but it would probably be in Braggadocio. More: Recent NY Times article on type nerds. Top 100 Fonts of All Time
